goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of flight delays and the range of delay times.

goals.question: What is the relationship between distance and flight time?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of distance vs. air time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between distance and flight time. It can also help us identify any outliers or anomalies.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight cancellations?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the reasons for flight cancellations and the frequency of each reason.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight routes?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the most popular flight routes and the frequency of flights on each route.

goals.question: What is the distribution of airline carriers?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the market share of each airline carrier and the frequency of flights operated by each carrier.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='departure_delay', kde=True, color='blue', bins=30)
    plt.axvline(data['departure_delay'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['departure_delay'].median():.2f}")
    plt.legend()
    plt.title("What is the distribution of flight delays?", wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel("Departure Delay (minutes)")
    plt.ylabel("Frequency")
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='distance', y='air_time')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between distance and flight time?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Distance')
    plt.ylabel('Air Time')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    # Count the frequency of each cancellation reason
    cancellation_counts = data['cancellation_reason'].value_counts()

    # Create a bar chart of cancellation reasons
    ax = sns.barplot(x=cancellation_counts.index, y=cancellation_counts.values)
    
    # Set the chart title
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight cancellations?', wrap=True)
    
    # Add a legend with various colors
    ax.legend(cancellation_counts.index, title='Cancellation Reasons', loc='upper right')

    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import geopandas as gpd
from shapely.geometry import LineString

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['origin_coord'] = list(zip(data['origin_longitude'], data['origin_latitude']))
    data['dest_coord'] = list(zip(data['dest_longitude'], data['dest_latitude']))
    data['geometry'] = data.apply(lambda x: LineString([x['origin_coord'], x['dest_coord']]), axis=1)
    gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(data, geometry='geometry')

    world = gpd.read_file(gpd.datasets.get_path('naturalearth_lowres'))
    ax = world.plot(color='white', edgecolor='black', figsize=(15, 10))
    gdf.plot(ax=ax, column='count', cmap='viridis', legend=True, linewidth=1)

    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight routes?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    carrier_counts = data['carrier'].value_counts()
    plt.pie(carrier_counts, labels=carrier_counts.index, autopct='%.2f%%')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of airline carriers?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend(carrier_counts.index, title="Carriers", loc="upper right")
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

    data['origin_coord'] = list(zip(data['origin_longitude'], data['origin_latitude']))
    data['dest_coord'] = list(zip(data['dest_longitude'], data['dest_latitude']))
    data['geometry'] = data.apply(lambda x: LineString([x['origin_coord'], x['dest_coord']]), axis=1)

    gdf.plot(ax=ax, column='count', cmap='viridis', legend=True, linewidth=1)

    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight routes?', wrap=True)
    return plt;
